If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if the outbreak is explicitly stated to be ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

This question does not consider any potential appeals or changes to the sentencing after it has occurred.

title: Will Shein and Temu resolve their legal dispute through a settlement by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Shein and Temu reach an official settlement agreement regarding their ongoing legal disputes, including but not limited to the lawsuit over alleged copyright infringements and other fraudulent activities. The settlement must be confirmed through at least one of the following means:

1. Official statements released by Shein or Temu
2. Court records or legal documents accessible to the public
3. Reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, Financial Times)

The settlement must address the core issues of the legal dispute, such as copyright infringement claims or allegations of fraudulent activities. A partial settlement or an agreement to postpone legal proceedings does not qualify for a YES resolution.

If no such settlement is reached and officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the legal proceedings continue beyond this date without a settlement, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Nebraska pass major property tax relief legislation by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Nebraska Legislature passes and the Governor signs into law a bill or set of bills that provide substantial property tax relief for Nebraska residents. To be considered substantial, the legislation must meet at least two of the following criteria:

1. Reduce the average property tax burden for Nebraska homeowners by at least 10% compared to the previous year.
2. Implement a new property tax credit or rebate program worth at least $500 million annually.
3. Fundamentally restructure the property tax system in a way that significantly reduces the reliance on property taxes for funding local services.

The passage and impact of such legislation must be reported by at least two major national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or three reputable local Nebraska news outlets.

If no legislation meeting these criteria is passed and signed into law by the specified date, or if passed legislation fails to meet the substantiality requirements, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the FTC's noncompete agreement ban be implemented by August 2024?
body:
This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission's (FTC) rule banning noncompete agreements is implemented nationwide in the United States. This implementation could occur through one of the following ways:

1. The ruling made by U.S. District Judge Ada Brown in Texas, which blocked the FTC's rule, is overturned by a higher court.
2. The FTC successfully appeals the ruling or finds an alternative legal pathway to implement the ban.
3. New legislation is passed that allows the FTC to implement the ban despite the court ruling.

For a YES resolution, the implementation of the ban must be confirmed through official government statements, court filings, or FTC announcements, and reported by at least two reputable national news sources. If the ban is not implemented by the resolution date due to ongoing legal challenges or other reasons, the question resolves as NO.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, House Republicans officially present new evidence alleging criminal wrongdoing by President Joe Biden. The evidence must be: 1. Officially presented by House Republicans in a formal capacity (e.g., during a congressional hearing, in an official report, or through a formal statement). 2. Reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, or The Washington Post). 3. Specifically alleging criminal wrongdoing by President Biden himself, not just his family members or associates. 4. New evidence that was not publicly known or presented before October 1, 2023. The question resolves as NO if no such new evidence meeting all the above criteria is presented by the resolution date. Note that the mere allegation of wrongdoing does not imply guilt or innocence; this question only concerns the presentation of new evidence by House Republicans.

title: Will a major U.S. university announce the elimination of more than five academic majors by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, any U.S. university with an enrollment of over 10,000 students officially announces the elimination of more than five academic majors. The elimination must be confirmed through official university communications or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The Chronicle of Higher Education, Inside Higher Ed, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). The announcement must clearly state that these majors are being completely eliminated, not merely restructured or merged. For the purpose of this question, an academic major refers to a primary field of study in which a student specializes at the undergraduate level. If no such announcement meeting these criteria is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

The data must be released by August 31, 2024. 'Enrolling directly' means students who begin college in the fall immediately following their high school graduation. If no such increase is confirmed, or if the percentage remains the same or decreases, the question resolves as NO. In case of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among at least three reputable sources will determine the resolution.

title: Will Stellantis announce layoffs of over 2,000 workers at its Warren Truck Plant by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Stellantis officially announces or implements layoffs exceeding 2,000 workers at its Warren Truck Plant located near Detroit. The confirmation must come from one of the following sources:

1. An official statement or press release from Stellantis
2. Reports from at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal)
3. A statement from the United Auto Workers union confirming the layoffs

The layoffs must be specifically for the Warren Truck Plant and not part of a broader company-wide reduction that happens to include some workers from this plant. Temporary furloughs or short-term layoffs with a predetermined return date do not count towards this total.

If no such announcement or implementation occurs by the specified date, or if the announced/implemented layoffs are 2,000 or fewer, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will Maine's three-day waiting period for gun purchases remain in effect through August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the three-day waiting period for gun purchases in Maine, implemented in 2023, remains in effect and is being enforced by gun retailers across the state. To be considered in effect:

1. The waiting period must be mandated by state law.
2. Gun retailers must be required to observe this waiting period for all applicable firearm purchases.
3. There should be no successful legal challenges or legislative actions that have nullified or significantly altered the waiting period requirement.

Confirmation of the law's continued effect must come from at least two of the following sources:
- Official statements or documents from the Maine state government
- Reports from reputable national or local news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Portland Press Herald, Bangor Daily News)
- Statements from law enforcement agencies or recognized firearms retailers' associations in Maine

If the waiting period has been repealed, significantly modified (e.g., shortened or lengthened), or is no longer being enforced by August 31, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a rule allowing certain immigrants to enroll in the Affordable Care Act be implemented by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a rule is successfully implemented that allows immigrants brought to the U.S. illegally as children to enroll in the Affordable Care Act (ACA) health insurance program. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The rule must be officially enacted by the U.S. federal government.
2. The rule must specifically target immigrants who were brought to the U.S. illegally as children.
3. The rule must grant these immigrants access to enroll in health insurance plans under the ACA.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. No such rule is implemented by August 31, 2024.
2. A rule is proposed but not officially enacted by the resolution date.
3. A rule is implemented but does not specifically allow the described group of immigrants to enroll in ACA health insurance plans.

Verification of the rule's implementation will be based on official government announcements or credible reports from major news organizations.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the governments of India and Vietnam jointly or separately announce an official plan or agreement to double their bilateral trade and investment within a specified timeframe. The announcement must: 1) Be made by authorized government representatives from either or both countries. 2) Explicitly state the intention to double trade and investment between India and Vietnam. 3) Be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, BBC, The New York Times, Associated Press). The question will resolve as NO if: 1) No such announcement is made by August 31, 2024. 2) An announcement is made but does not specifically mention doubling trade and investment. 3) The announcement is made by unofficial sources or is not corroborated by reputable news outlets. Note: This question does not require the actual doubling of trade and investment to occur by the resolution date, only the official announcement of such a plan.
